dismissalText.commentary: Shai Hope lbw b Kuldeep Yadav 43 (45b 4x4 1x6 76m) SR: 95.55

dismissalComment.html: Goes for the reverse-sweep and Hope yorks himself! Hope reviews immediately. This was pushed through full on off, turning into him as he looked to reverse-sweep it. Looked plumb and the umpire gave it out immediately. No bat, UltraEdge confirms. And HawkEye shows the ball clipping the leg bail so it's Umpire's Call. West Indies keep the review, but more importantly, lose the review

videos.title: Watch - West Indies lose Hope to Kuldeep
videos.seoTitle: Watch - West Indies lose Hope to Kuldeep

headshotImage.caption: RA Jadeja headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: RA Jadeja headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Alick Athanaze c Jadeja b Mukesh Kumar 22 (18b 3x4 1x6 26m) SR: 122.22

dismissalComment.html: Jadeja takes a jumping catch, Mukesh has his first ODI wicket. Ball was short and wide, may have shaped away a bit but the hard cut shot was on. Athanaze went for it but got it flat and right above Jadeja, who timed his jump well and clawed it just over head-height, he did well to land safely. Mukesh is pumped. Athanaze, who was starting to find his feet, had to pay the price

images.longCaption: Kuldeep Yadav took 4 for 6 in his three overs, West Indies vs India, 1st ODI, Bridgetown, July 27, 2023

headshotImage.caption: Dominic Drakes, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Dominic Drakes, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: And Kuldeep strikes! But Drakes reviews immediately. This was a subtle wrong'un fired full and straight outside off. Spun in past the inside edge as Drakes pressed forward to defend. No bat involved. Impact was plumb in front of middle and the ball was going on to hit the leg-stump, HawkEye confirms. Kuldeep gets in on the action. West Indies seven down and still a run away from getting to 100

headshotImage.caption: Yannic Cariah, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Yannic Cariah, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: Loud appeal again as a wrong'un raps him on the pad! India review. Cariah went back to defend this time and the ball went on to hit him on the knee roll of the front pad. That's three reds on HawkEye and Cariah has to go! Impact was in front of middle and off and the ball was crashing into middle. Wrong'un gets Kuldeep his second wicket

Looked plumb and the umpire gave it out immediately. No bat, UltraEdge confirms. And HawkEye shows the ball clipping the leg bail so it's Umpire's Call. West Indies keep the review, but more importantly, lose the review

headshotImage.caption: Jayden Seals player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jayden Seals player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Clipped to leg-slip where Hardik Pandya takes a good catch and that will be all! Figures of 4 for 6 for Kuldeep as West Indies fold for 114. Another googly this time, turning in from a length outside off. Seales was caught between defending forward and back and ended up prodding his bat in front. The inside edge went to Hardik, who made no mistake

dismissalText.commentary: Kyle Mayers c Sharma b Pandya 2 (9b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 22.22

dismissalComment.html: Pulled to mid-on. Mayers made room and tried to flat-bat it with power. The ball, on a back of length, swung in late and cramped him for room. Hit the bat well above the sweet spot and Rohit took a dolly at mid-on.

dismissalText.commentary: Brandon King b Thakur 17 (23b 3x4 0x6 44m) SR: 73.91

dismissalComment.html: Through the defence, Shardul is pumping the air as another batter, close to getting set, is out in the powerplay. Wobbler on a length, King stood upright and tried to punch it straight. Looked like he expected the ball to bounce more than it did, the ball seamed in and beat the inside edge. Hands of three kids in the crowd go on heads as the hosts lose another.

dismissalText.commentary: Suryakumar Yadav lbw b Motie 19 (25b 3x4 1x6 30m) SR: 76

dismissalComment.html: Misses the sweep again, and this time he has been given out! Full on middle and off again and straightening with the spin. Looks plumb if no connection with bat or glove. Ultraedge confirms there was no bat on that. And it's hitting top of off so SKY will have to go. He had a good chance here to make a mark in a format he hasn't quite shone in, but he goes cheaply

dismissalComment.html: King takes a sharp catch to the right at second slip or has he? Umpires will send it upstairs for a confirmation. His left leg braced as the right knee bent, the hands went low to clasp the ball. The fingers were underneath the ball. Third umpire Marais Erasmus looks at a couple of angles. He is happy with the fingers being below and says it's out. Great ball: on a length just outside off. Decked away just a bit. Gill tried to punch it towards cover and got a thick outside edge.

commentTextItems.html: And Rohit finishes things off in style! Gets down and sweeps it away through midwicket as India complete the chase in almost the same time they took to bowl West Indies out

commentPostTextItems.html: 2pm Well, that's an early, early finish at Bridgetown, with less than fifty overs being bowled in total! Be sure to join us again on Saturday to see how West Indies respond after this performance. For now, it's goodbye from Ekanth, Chandan, Ranjith and me!

Rohit Sharma: "To be honest, I never thought the pitch was going to play like that. It was the team's need that we wanted to have a score in front of us but never thought the pitch would deteriorate like that. It had something for everyone. But never thought we'd restrict them to that low a score. [On the batting order] We said that we wanted to give a chance to the guys. Never thought we'd lose five wickets but it was a good chance to give a chance to a lot of the guys who have just come in. I thought restricting them to 115 got us in a commanding position that we needed so we thought we could give those guys a chance who haven't played a lot in the last few weeks. [On if he remembers the last time he came out at No. 7] It was my debut actually! Mukesh has been brilliant. Even in Tests we saw he can swing the new ball, has a bit of pace and quite consistent as well. So we want to see what he has to offer. Haven't seen him much so it was good to see what he can do with a white ball. The take away from this game was the bowling effort. Even with conditions favouring you you have to bowl well. And Kishan did well with the bat."

Shai Hope: "Let's just say we didn't play the way we needed to. On a challenging pitch, we need to find ways to score. I'm not making excuses but anyone watching cricket can see what's happening here. But we have to find ways to score. [Seales] He is a quality player. Worth investing in. Going from strength to strength. We knew an early start here would be difficult and the Indian bowlers did well on this surface, but again we didn't bat very well."

Kuldeep Yadav is the player of the match. Here's what he has to say: "[On India's bowling performance] Perfect. Started off with the fast bowlers. Mukesh, making his debut. Shardul and Hardik got wickets too. Me and Jadeja, we were great. Just following the routine and rhythm and it's been amazing in the last one year. Focusing on the length is more important than getting wickets. People say it's a seaming paradis and I was happy that [spinners] got seven wickets from our side and some from their side as well. It was spinning a bit and there was bounce as well. It's always good to have competition, but me and Chahal don't think about the competition and just work with each other. When you have seniors like Chahal to help you it gives you a lot of confidence. We have been playing together for five or six years so he has really helped. There's no competition, we just give each other great company."

Anjan: "WI bowled really well, especially Motie. In the next game, if the pitch is the same, they just need to bat first and back themselves to get 200." Yes, they definitely would have had  good shout if they had stitched maybe one or two more handy partnerships. The pitch had a lot for the spinners and Motie and Cariah both were looking in good rhythm and hitting the right areas.

1.45pmComprehensive win for India. They let Rohit and Virat rest for the most part, letting everyone else have a go. Rohit did have to come out, as West Indies' spinners found good purchase and bowled well. But the total was too low for India to be troubled. The performance from Cariah and Motie are probably the only positives for West Indies. For India, Kishan did well with the bat, but it was still at the top of the order so his middle order credentials could still come under questions, but he won't care about all that for now, having added a fine half-century to his resume. Jadeja and Kuldeep were just unplayable once they got going. Mukesh Kumar also got a wicket on ODI debut, so plenty to celebrate for the visitors.

On a length on off, Jadeja defends. So we will have at least another over

dismissalText.commentary: Alick Athanaze c Jadeja b Mukesh Kumar 22 (18b 3x4 1x6 26m) SR: 122.22

dismissalComment.html: Jadeja takes a jumping catch, Mukesh has his first ODI wicket. Ball was short and wide, may have shaped away a bit but the hard cut shot was on. Athanaze went for it but got it flat and right above Jadeja, who timed his jump well and clawed it just over head-height, he did well to land safely. Mukesh is pumped. Athanaze, who was starting to find his feet, had to pay the price

dismissalComment.html: Goes for the reverse-sweep and Hope yorks himself! Hope reviews immediately. This was pushed through full on off, turning into him as he looked to reverse-sweep it. West Indies keep the review, but more importantly, lose the review

dismissalText.commentary: Dominic Drakes lbw b Kuldeep Yadav 3 (5b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: And Kuldeep strikes! But Drakes reviews immediately. This was a subtle wrong'un fired full and straight outside off. Spun in past the inside edge as Drakes pressed forward to defend. No bat involved. Impact was plumb in front of middle and the ball was going on to hit the leg-stump, HawkEye confirms. Kuldeep gets in on the action. West Indies seven down and still a run away from getting to 100

dismissalText.commentary: Yannic Cariah lbw b Kuldeep Yadav 3 (9b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: Loud appeal again as a wrong'un raps him on the pad! India review. Cariah went back to defend this time and the ball went on to hit him on the knee roll of the front pad. That's three reds on HawkEye and Cariah has to go! Impact was in front of middle and off and the ball was crashing into middle. Wrong'un gets Kuldeep his second wicket

images.longCaption: Mukesh Kumar removed Alick Athanaze for his first ODI wicket, West Indies vs India, 1st ODI, Bridgetown, July 27, 2023

dismissalComment.html: Jadeja takes a jumping catch, Mukesh has his first ODI wicket. Ball was short and wide, may have shaped away a bit but the hard cut shot was on. Athanaze went for it but got it flat and right above Jadeja, who timed his jump well and clawed it just over head-height, he did well to land safely. Mukesh is pumped. Athanaze, who was starting to find his feet, had to pay the price

dismissalComment.html: Clipped to leg-slip where Hardik Pandya takes a good catch and that will be all! Figures of 4 for 6 for Kuldeep as West Indies fold for 114. Another googly this time, turning in from a length outside off. Seales was caught between defending forward and back and ended up prodding his bat in front. The inside edge went to Hardik, who made no mistake

videos.title: Watch - Kuldeep Yadav's fourth strike sends Jayden Seales back

videos.summary: West Indies folded for 114, as the batter inside-edged to leg slip

dismissalComment.html: King takes a sharp catch to the right at second slip or has he? Umpires will send it upstairs for a confirmation. His left leg braced as the right knee bent, the hands went low to clasp the ball. The fingers were underneath the ball. Third umpire Marais Erasmus looks at a couple of angles. He is happy with the fingers being below and says it's out. Great ball: on a length just outside off. Decked away just a bit. Gill tried to punch it towards cover and got a thick outside edge.
